name: Tigh-Na-Mara Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights in room 314B. The arrangement in the building we stayed in is that there is an "A" and a "B" room for each room number. The two units can be combined to form one very large unit or rented out separately, as was the case with us. The "A" is the larger of the two by far. Our room was on the upper floor and have a magnificent view of the beach and ocean. It also had a cathedral ceiling which was made the room seem larger, which is good as the room wasn't particularly large. There was a nice balcony. The room was comfortable and had a gas fireplace. The only issue I had with the room is the amount of noise you can hear associated with the plumbing, both from our bathroom and our neighbors, but this was easily bearable.
reviews.title: Great Beach!

reviews.text: The whole resort has a rustic feel to it and is very family oriented. When we were visiting there were many, many children about. This didn't present a problem for us but if you're looking for an "adult" resort, this isn't it.
reviews.title: Great Position

likes.liked: — rustic bungalow, beach and general ambience. spa also a good experience. good activities for kids like beading and bear making.guest services helpful and polite
likes.disliked: — lack of beach facilities, disorganisation and inconsistent cleanliness.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was very nice. We ate breakfast and dinner there twice and had a good meal each time.
reviews.title: Nice mid-island get-away

reviews.text: We also made use of the spa. I went for a massage and my spouse bought a day pass for the spa complex, $40 (my massage included this). I rarely go to spas so my point of view may be a little suspect. I thought the massage was good. The spa was fine but to me it looked like the pool area needs a bit of work, mainly touching up the paint. There were a few chairs in the pool area but not enough for the number of people that were in there; there were a few more chairs outside but it was too cool to use them. I guess we could have brought the chairs in ourselves but we were lucky enough to snag one of the ones already inside.
reviews.title: spectacular

reviews.text: For me the point of staying here was the beach. At low tide the water runs way, way out, it must be a kilometer or more. Lots of people go out and walk the beach at low tide and then walk way out to the water's edge and watch as it slowly starts its way back in. You should go there just for this, and our room offered a great view of it. If you ask the hotel they can tell you when to expect low tide each day so that you can plan to be there for it.
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.text: My girlfriends and I booked the Desperate Housewives pkg. We had the best time ever. The room was beautiful with new furniture, the new pool was amazing. We are going to bring our families in the summer. The spa was incredible with the Endless Tapas! Everything was clean and the staff was so welcoming and friendly, everywhere we went the staff was accomodating. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay, we will see you in the summer!
reviews.title: Fun, fun, fun

likes.liked: — the staff and the amazing spa

reviews.title: Full Moon Tranquility
reviews.text: Located along a strip of shoreline, Tigh-na-mara offers a serenity that none other can compare. My window looked out onto the Georgia Straight, a pictoresque view of ocean water, mountains and a wide span of blue sky. In a few minutes, I was able to transplant myself from the vaulted ceiling room to the beach down below. I felt like I had finally come home when I took of my sandals and walked barefoot along the shore. The scent of ocean sprayed across the water, arriving with the gentle breeze that caressed my face. Shells, seaweeds and empty crabshells turned the morning into a childish game as I stepped, scooped and stored the newfound treasures into my pocket. Invigorated by my seaside explorations, I made my way through the tall cedar trees along the forested path to The Grotto. Within seconds of entering the spa building, I was overwhelmed by a sense of tranquility and calm. A stream of cascading water welcomed me on my way to the inner water sanctuary. To prepare for the mineral pool, I showered under a unique copperhead faucet reminiscent of ancient times. My mental pace began to diminish, as reluctant as my body was to slow down - slow down from the pace of living that modern life demands. I stepped into the warm waters of the healing bath and sunk into bliss. Floating and careening through the water steadily drew me into a deeper state of relaxation. My mind dreamed of cultures of people who, over the centuries, regularly returned to such sacred aqueous areas to rejuvenate and detoxify their bodies. The traditions of water therapy balance the body at all levels of existence - physical, emotional, mental and spiritual. Bathing in the mineral waters simply is similar to our sojourn in the saline waters of the womb awaiting birth. Upon leaving Tigh-na-mara, I felt reborn, full of new dreams and rekindled hope. I look forward to returning.

My family (my spouse , 2 kids and our dog) just spent over a week at The Tigh-Na-Mara in a cozy log cabin. The resort was great! The staff were so helpful.The beach was amazing, I guess the pool has just been reopened after extensive reno's but was wonderful, what a great way for the kids to burn off that last little bit of energy before going for a great dinner at the restaurant.
reviews.title: A great Local Family Retreat

likes.liked: — The cabin, Very modern amenities but still felt like a rustic getaway
likes.disliked: — No direct restaurant room service, they did offer to provide meals as a picnic though

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent quaility time together with the TV off playing games and sitting around the fireplace. Just unwinding. We will definatley be returning. I recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Romantic Weekend success

reviews.text: We also met a nice couple who were there on their honeymoon. They had spent the day at The Spa and couldn't say enough about how amazed they were with the entire resort. Maybe next time we just might leave the kids at home ;)
reviews.title: Yuk

reviews.text: My three girlfriends and I went to TNM for our first girls getaway - we often go to spas for each other's birthdays (4 times a year), and one of the girls is planning to get married this year, so we wanted to do something extra special.
reviews.title: Girls Getaway - a great bonding experience

likes.liked: — everything - the murphy bed and pillows were surprisingly comfortable!

reviews.text: TNM has a Desperate Housewives package going on this year. It includes 2 nights accommodation, $50 credit at the spa, and endless tapas at the Treetop Lounge in the spa (it's a restaurant in the spa where you dine in your robes, only spa clients are allowed) (a $40 value). Plus a bottle of wine. Cost depends on what accommodations you choose.
reviews.title: Amazing Place for the family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had been there previously on another occasion, so I knew where the spa was in proximity to the accommodations. I also stayed at one of the spa bungalow suites previously, and it was an exquisite room. So I made sure to book a 2 bdrm spa bungalow suite for our excursion. It is the more expensive option, but totally worth it if you want the full luxury experience.
reviews.title: The Good & the Bad

likes.disliked: — The uncomfortable bed & view of construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Day 1: We arrived on Saturday afternoon and checked into the resort. After checking in, we drove right up to our suite and parked in front in the gravel parking lot. The room was, for the most part, ready to go - it wasn't quite ready for 4 girls though (not enough towels and soap/shampoo, and our bottle of wine wasn't there either, kitchen towels were missing). I called front desk and requested some towels and soaps, and they dropped it off right away. I called them back when I realized the wine was missing, and they dropped it off while we were at the spa. We got a free pass to go into the mineral bath (normally a $40 value) - you get to go to the mineral bath with your 1hr+ spa treatment (which we were doing the next day), so we wanted to maximize the experience and spent the evening at the mineral bath. It was a great experience - the mineral bath was absolutely amazing, there's a mineral pool, hot tub, and cold shower, some lounging chairs with tables and magazines, and a water cooler so we could stay hydrated - the only comment I have is that they ran out of robes that evening. We stayed in the suite for the evening, made dinner (we brought groceries with us) and played games and chatted the night away. The 2 bdrm suite has two bedrooms (one with a king sized bed, fireplace, and tv in it) and a murphy bed in the living room - plenty of space for us.
reviews.title: Log cabins are horrible

reviews.text: Day 2: SPA DAY!!! (Make sure to book everything way in advance of your trip) We had to split up some of the treatments so one girl went for her 90 minute massage at 10am while the rest of us slept in. Then we checked into the spa so that we could all meet up at TreeTop Lounge (on the top floor of the spa, third floor). The women's locker room on the main floor is huge, lots of lockers, lots of space, plenty of change rooms, mirrors, showers with space to put your robe and to change in (the shower heads were really interesting, big wide rain-like pouring spouts) Up at the lounge (in our robes), the server said that the tapas were quite small, there was a selection of 40 altogether, but I can tell you that they weren't that small - each of the tapas were creatively and beautifully presented on their own plates, one by one. Absolutely exquisite! We ordered 26 of the 40 tapas and most of them were fantastic! We ate luxuriously for 2.5 hours (let me know if you want to see pictures, we took one of every dish we got!). There is a spa concierge and the lounging area just outside of the restaurant - I let the concierge know that we were still eating, and they had our massage therapists come to get us right in the restaurant! So 3 of us girls had our 90 minute massages at that time. My massage was very relaxing, the blanket kept me warm and comfy - so much so that I fell asleep (the food probably did it too). It was a relaxation massage (not therapeutic) because my attendant was not a registered massage therapist from BC (you would have to check with them first if that's what you needed). After our massages, we went back and relaxed and rehydrated in the lounge until we were due for our pedicures - there is a main lounge area and also a women's only lounge area - we tried them both. The main lounge area had beverages (tea, water) and fruits to snack on, the women's lounge didn't, but an attendant came to check on us and to see if we wanted anything! Our estheticians came up to get us in the lounge, and we went down to the main floor into the manicure/pedicure room. We sat in reclining massage chairs with foot baths. The 3 other girls had 90 minute pedicures, and I had the basic 60 minute sport pedicure - this is the only disappointing part of the experience for me - the 90 minute pedicure included a foot/leg/hand massage and paraffin wax, as well as a polish. The sport pedicure only had the hand/leg massage and no polish, but I felt that my treatment was not performed well - she barely massaged my feet, and the overall result wasn't very good - I ended up having to do more work on my feet back at the suite. I left the spa earlier and walked back to the suite to prepare dinner (it was a light meal since we were all still full from lunch). Somehow my room pass stopped working so I had to walk back to the spa and had them deliver a new pass. The rest of the girls came back to the suite while I was setting up, and we spent another evening chatting, playing games, and eating - we wanted to go back to the mineral bath, but we ran out of time.
reviews.title: Great Setting & Amazing Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a cottage at Tigh Na Mara to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We'd stayed there a few times before and have always had good experiences. This time, however, we found ourselves in the middle of a major party (of firefighters, no less) who congregated under the massive tree cover outside one of the cottages and continued to get more inebriated and louder as the evening wore on. Close to midnight we called the front desk and asked to have the party either moved indoors or shutdown, which it immediately was.
reviews.title: Wonderful Property

reviews.text: The next morning the manager called us to profusely apologise (although we hadn't expected that) and to offer us our second night's stay in a spa room away from the cottages - a significant upgrade. He also gave us complimentary brunch passes to make up for the inconvenience.
reviews.title: Great for Families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tigh Na Mara continues to wow us with their excellence in hospitality, great accommodations, and superlative cuisine. Go. You won't regret it.
reviews.title: Relaxing romantic experience

likes.liked: — Ambience, a combination of views, soaker tub, nature.

reviews.text: We just returned from three nights at Tigh na Mara and had a great time. We had a studio unit in the Jedediah lodge. It was clean and looked recently renovated. It had a queen bed and a Murphy bed for the kids. The kitchenette was spotless and really useful traveling with two children. Our one complaint was the sound proofing. If you are a light sleeper and had loud neighbors a different location may be better for you. The beach is great and we were able to walk forever when the tide was out. Lot's of affordable family dining within 5 minutes and of course lots of mini-golf. We will be back again.
reviews.title: Simply awful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I just returned from our one night stay at Tigh-Na-Mara. We had an amazing and relaxing mini vacation and the moment we arrived we wanted to stay longer.
reviews.title: Terrific Times at Tigh-Na-Mara

description: Tigh-Na-Mara Seaside Spa Resort is located in 22 acres of forest beside the ocean. The Resort features unique log-style accommodation units, gas fireplace and kitchenette in every guestroom as well as three on-site restaurants, a full service spa, indoor pool and fitness centre. Every stay at Tigh-Na-Mara includes complimentary parking, complimentary wireless internet and complimentary local and calling card calls. The Resort also offers direct beach access and six golf courses nearby.
